channel.title: Virtual Machines :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: A virtual machine is a simulated computing device. Letâ€™s start with a simple example. You can play classic NES and Super NES games using the Switch. How is this done? Does the Switch contain the same hardware as the original NES or SNES? No. It uses a NVIDA Tegra processor, which utilizes the 64-bit ARM architecture. The NES used an 8-bit CPU, and the SNES used a 16-bit CPU. These are very different architectures.
